oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mixing fish killer
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Clement, William L., photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Loyd Henegar mixing powdered rotenone with water to eradicate wild fish from new pond before stocking. 30 lbs. 5% rotenone and 48 lbs. 1% rotenone used. Located fifteen miles northeast of Woodbury.

One in a series of photographs of agricultural activities in Cannon County, TN that were taken by W.L. Clement, District Conservationist for the U.S. Soil Conservation Service, and his assistants between the mid-1940s and mid-1970s.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photographs of W.L. Clement, U.S. Soil Conservation Service
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Fish stocking;
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Publication of the United States government. Not copyrighted
